Title: Improved Trust in Human-Robot Collaboration With ChatGPT
Abstract: human robot collaboration is becoming increasingly important as robots become more involved in various aspects of human life in the era of artificial intelligence. however the issue of human operators‚äô trust in robots remains a significant concern primarily due to the lack of adequate semantic understanding and communication between humans and robots. the emergence of large language models  large language model  such as chatgpt provides an opportunity to develop an interactive communicative and robust human robot collaboration approach. this paper explores the impact of chatgpt on trust in a human robot collaboration assembly task. this study designs a robot control system called robogpt using chatgpt to control a 7 degree of freedom robot arm to help human operators fetch and place tools while human operators can communicate with and control the robot arm using natural language. a human subject experiment showed that incorporating chatgpt in robots significantly increased trust in human robot collaboration which can be attributed to the robot‚äôs ability to communicate more effectively with humans. furthermore chatgpt‚äôs ability to understand the nuances of human language and respond appropriately helps to build a more natural and intuitive human robot interaction. the findings of this study have significant implications for the development of trustworthy human robot collaboration systems.
